data.title: Zooming causing "reference" indicator to become misplaced
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any project in VS Code
2. Zoom in
3. Note Reference Indicators get shifted under the left panes

![screen shot 2016-11-14 at 3 04 31 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5638847/20281896/58f719b0-aa80-11e6-936f-e24c3bfdc065.png)

data.title: Integrated Terminal with git-bash sometimes drops letters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider 
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

When typing out commands using the integrated terminal using git-bash ("terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe"), sometimes letters aren't included in the actual command even though they're on the screen. I'm unable to reproduce it every time, but it usually occurs when I press backspace quickly and retype something. I'm running windows in a VM on macOS if that matters. In the first screenshot it dropped the 'a' from 'auth' and in the second screenshot it dropped the 'u' from 'checkout'

![auth](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9434919/20281401/f85bffda-aa75-11e6-96e4-56282a118ad5.PNG)

![checkout](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9434919/20281402/fc2b629a-aa75-11e6-9f7c-a49fa8f27d5e.PNG)

data.title: Unchecking "Uncaught Exceptions" in debugger does nothing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.9.7|
|docthis|joelday|0.3.5|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.2.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have some code that throws an exception.
2. Place breakpoint before the exception.
3. Uncheck "Uncaught Exceptions" from breakpoints panel.
4. Run program.

Despite "Uncaught Exceptions" being deselected VSCode still seems to break on it. Am I doing something wrong?

data.title: Support MacOS Sierra application tabs for multiple windows
data.body:
Hi vscode,

I wanted to ask about MacOS Sierra's tab support for applications - from Apple marketing, we hear that tabs for applications should "just work".

For some applications, when multiple windows are open, the option appears in the menu bar under Window -> Merge All Windows. It would be awesome to manage multiple Code windows in this way, if the implementation is a config change or similar.

This is slightly related to #396, but ultimately serves a different purpose.

EDIT: While using the application, I realized that Cmd+Opt+Shift+N is actually able to create a new tab today - perhaps there is no extra work needed after all!

data.title: Support dependencies for VSIX extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
~~~
Version 1.7.1
Commit 02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44
Date 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z
Shell 1.3.8
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0
~~~

- OS Version: `Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14393]`

**Problem**:  specifying “extensionDependencies” in the extension manifest does not work as intended.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1.  Open a simple VS Code extension project
2.  In package.json, specify `extensionDependencies`

In my case, I had this code:
```
    "extensionDependencies": [
        "samverschueren.yo"
    ]
```
3. package the extension as .vsix and import it in another instance of VSCode.

**Expected**: VSCode extension dependencies are installed
**Actual**: extension dependencies aren't installed.

Furthermore, if i uninstall my extension, VSCode asks if it should uninstall dependencies as well and if answered yes, extension dependencies are properly removed. This tells me I got the extension name `$publisher.$name` right. So, it seems to me that, uninstall flow works as expected and install does not. Unless, I'm missing something.

data.title: File completer should score contiguous matches higher
data.body: Here's an example: The file `cmd/gradient/main.go` is scored lower even though the text I typed matches contiguously. The top matches have matched random characters in other file names which seem to have accidentally have bumped their score up, even though the matches make less sense.

data.title: Missing Feature: File parser, element index, function list.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

I'm missing a feature that lists all the elements (or tags) in a file like function, variables, etc. in a similar way that is provided by the CTags/Sidekick plugins do for other code editors. This is especially useful when one is trying to understand an undocumented part of the source code, file structure or assembly package.

data.title: remapping keyboard shortcut for delete not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: OS X el capitan

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  add ```{
        "key": "cmd+delete",
        "command": "editor.action.deleteLines",
        "when": "editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly"
    }``` to keybindings.json
2.  hit cmd+delete while editing. still triggers the original shortcut

I tried mapping the editor.action.deleteLines command to another key and it worked. 
I tried mapping cmd+delete to another command and it did not work.

data.title: Signed commits broken?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|RustyCode|saviorisdead|0.19.1|
|vscode-lldb|vadimcn|0.3.1|
|debug|webfreak|0.12.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup signed commits with GPG
2. Try to commit something within VSCode.

Here's the relevant git log message:
```
git add -A -- .
git commit --quiet --allow-empty-message --file - --all
error: gpg failed to sign the data
fatal: failed to write commit object
```

data.title: Ctrl + backspace improvement for snake case
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Linux

When using Ctrl+backspace on code written in snake case, it doesn't stop on '_'  and deletes the hole variable/method.
It would be great to have this shortcut work for all cases:
- snake case: n_count
- camel case:  nCount 
- Kebab case: n-count (this one i found on the web, just adding it to the list)
etc

data.title: Hot exit on switching folders
data.body:
Parent issue: #101

Sublime has a feature that allows hot exit to *always* be allowed on a window provided it has a project associated with it. The initial concern still remains that backups may go missing if we just always enable this, the Sublime project system is nice because the act of creating a project (`.sublime-project`) is basically an opt in for project-level features.

Interested in people's ideas on this, here are a few:

- Enabling switching folders all the time?
- Enable if `<project>/.vscode` exists?
- Enable if a setting is toggled?
- Enable if a setting includes the workspace path? (has issues with multi-folder workspaces)

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

```
{
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.detectIndentation": false,
  "editor.renderWhitespace": true,
  "editor.formatOnType": true,
  "extensions.autoUpdate": true,
  "window.reopenFolders": "none",
  "html.format.extraLiners": "",
  "html.format.indentInnerHtml": true,
  "html.format.unformatted": "",
  "editor.formatOnSave": true
}
```
2. Sometimes VS Code misthinking and make all tabs in file = 4 (edit on save).

data.title: Always start with "Expression" when editing breakpoints for the first time
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

- create new breakpoint and start editing the breakpoint

Observe: the drop down menu in the peek UI shows "Expression"

- edit condition then edit hit count
- close breakpoint peek UI
- create new breakpoint and start editing

Observe: the drop down menu in the peek UI now shows "Hit Count"

When editing independent breakpoints it is not helpful to remember what was edited last in a different breakpoint. It suggest to always start with a stable UI, that is start in "Expression" mode.

data.title: Does the VSCode support such debug situation: "Python script call c function, and we want to debug this c function"?
files.associations "javascript" not forwarded to TypeScript Service
Format selection inconsistencies
Saving with "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true clears the redo buffer if you have any trailing whitespaces.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1 
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.12 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a line with trailing whitespace.
2. Add another line.
2. Undo the added line.
3. Save.
4. Attempt to redo. (You can't.)


"files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true probably should not manipulate the open file, just the one being saved. Not being able to redo is unexpected and can lead to lost work.

data.title: [C/C++] syntax highlight after calling macro without semicolon
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a macro that doesn't / can't end with a semicolon
2. Next line after calling said macro won't be syntactically highlighted

Example:
```
#define BEGIN_NAMESPACE(name) namespace name {

BEGIN_NAMESPACE(test)
class Test {}; // won't be colored, regardless of whitespace (newlines) in between
```

data.title: Understand extension host reliability
data.body: The *format-on-save*-feature has uncovered that there are dead extension hosts which never talk back to us. While we have designed the editor for that case it is still a pity and we should understand why that is and look for extensions that might cause this.

data.title: Improve workbench start-up performance
data.body: Startup performance for some users is very bad and we should understand why.

data.title: Status codes and well-defined errors in XYZProvider interfaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: We should explore a list of well defined errors and status codes with which data provider can signal reasons for not producing a result. A sample would be a `DefinitionProvider` which can produce a result because it lacks configuration or is still fetching required data (`d.ts`-loading)

data.title: VSCode corrupts 'registered sign' character
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10240
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.4.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open file containing 'registered sign' character `®` 
Ex.: `Microsoft® .NET Framework`
2. The character is replaced by `�` 
Ex.: `Microsoft� .NET Framework`
